abstract.text: Implement this protocol to describe a player in your turn-based game so that a strategist object can plan game moves.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You adopt this protocol to describe the gameplay of your turn-based game for use by a
object. The strategist uses your player class, along with other custom classes you implement (adopting the
protocols) to plan moves in your game.
You use your custom class implementing this protocol in several places:
properties of your game model class, to describe the set of players in your game and indicate which playerâ€™s turn it currently is
method of your game model class, to describe the set of moves currently valid for a specified player
method of your game model class, to rate the desirability of that particular state of the game model to a specified player
method to find an optimal move, to indicate the player for whom GameplayKit should plan moves
Your class that implements this protocol can also contain properties and methods relevant to the implementation of your gameâ€”for example, an identifying color or name.
For more information about describing your gameplay model and using a strategist, see

abstract.text: Architect and organize your game logic.Â Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.
Implement this protocol to describe your gameplay model so that a strategist object can plan game moves.
The player whose turn it currently is in the game.
Returns the set of moves available to the specified player.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified player has lost the game.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the current state of the game model reflects a win for the specified player.
The players currently in the game.
Returns a number rating the desirability of the game modelâ€™s current state from the perspective of the specified player.
Implement this protocol to describe a player in your turn-based game so that a strategist object can plan game moves.
A number uniquely identifying the player.
Implement this protocol to describe a move in your turn-based game so that a strategist object can plan game moves.
An AI that chooses moves in turn-based games using a
strategy.
Computes and returns the best possible move for the specified player.
Computes several of the best possible moves for the specified player, and returns a move randomly selected from among them.
An AI that chooses moves in turn-based games using a
strategy.
A general interface for objects that provide artificial intelligence for use in turn-based (and similar) games.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
